events.description: Bring your instruments, set the stage on fire and make the crowd go crazy with some mind-blowing performances and show us who owns the stage in this battle!
rules: The band size is supposed to be 8 members at maximum.
Limit performance time to 18 minutes(including setup)
Eastern and western performances are allowed.
SAM ID / online registration is a must.
Video to be submitted for shortlisting (5 mins max, send it to musicclub.iiitdm@gmail.com)
Participant can perform only for one band. Extra points for original compositions!
Only a drum kit and keyboard stand will be provided.
Decision of the judges is final and binding.
Any act of misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize: First Place - Prizes worth 20K Second Place - Prizes worth 15K

events.description: You’re insecure, don’t know what for! Come sing with us and rock the floor. Calling all the hummers, profes- sionals and wannabes to sing your heart out, be it kara- oke or not.
rules: Any genre of music is allowed.
SAM ID / online registration is a must:on-spot registration at the last moment will not be allowed
Video to be submitted for shortlisting (4 mins max send it to musicclub.iiitdm@gmail.com)
One submission per participant
Final performance should be under 5 minutes.
Participant may use a karaoke or any accompanying instrument (played by him/her or another one person) though only vocals will be judged.
Decision of the judges is final and binding. Any act of misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize: First Place- Prizes worth 6K Second Place- Prizes worth 3K

events.description: Clear shot. Kill streaks. No luck. Solemn skills.Gather your mates, plan your strategy and take it all.
rules: Game Settings

All matches will be played on Counter-Strike: Global Offensive servers with the latest game patch of “Counter-Strike: Global Offensive”. A knife round will determine who willstart as Counter-Terrorists (CT) and as Terrorists (T).A match consists of 30 rounds. Each team has to play 15 rounds as Counter-Terrorists (CT) and 15 rounds as Terrorists (T). The team winning 16 rounds out of 30 wins the match.

Incase of a 15-15 draw 4 rounds will be played (2 ct / 2 t). 3 win,
  • Round time - 1 min 45 sec;/li>
  • Buy time – 15 sec;/li>
  • C4 timer – 40 sec;
  • freeze time – 6 sec.
  • fTime out(2 per team)- 60 sec
  • Time out(2 per team)- 60 sec

During a game Team Captain: Each team must present have 1 (one) representative. He is responsible for histeam and will be responsible for choosing maps and all communication with referees must bedone through the team captain.

Picks and Bans - he map pool consists of the following five (7) maps,
  • Mirage
  • Cache
  • Overpass
  • Train
  • Nuke
  • Dust
  • Inferno

ALL matches are 'Best-of-One' matches (Bo1), both teams alternately eliminate one (1) mapuntil only one (1) map is left .The remaining map will be played. The team mentioned first in the match details starts with the procedure. Map votes will be done before the match starts

Results and Tie Breaker - If too many teams have the same score and it's therefore not clear who moves on to the next stage the following criteria are used to determine the exact ranking:,
  • Match wins Overall
  • Match wins Head to Head
  • Score Difference Head to Head
events.prize: First Place - Prizes worth 7K Second Place - Prizes worth 4K Third Place - Prizes worth 2K

events.description: The battle demands blood. Guide your gang, or fly solo to taste some delicious chicken for your dinner.
rules: It is enough for the team captain alone to fill the form.
First 25 teams
No emulators allowed (Will be immediately kicked from the game room).
Squads.
Map that will be played is Erangel.
TPP mode.
Participants are requested to take screenshot at the end.
First come first service
events.prize: Prizes worth 2.5K

events.description: The battle demands blood. Guide your gang, or fly solo to taste some delicious chicken for your dinner.
rules: It is enough for the team captain alone to fill the form.
A team of five

events.description: Experience what it takes to control your favourite player. Play to prove the pride of your jersey and shoot for victory.
rules: The game version that will be played is FIFA 19(1v1).(Mode of matches will be Knock Out).
Knockout round halftime - 4mins;semis - 5 mins; Finals - 6 mins (tentative).
It is highly advised to bring YOUR OWN controller and keyboard. Laptop will be provided.
Opponents will be drawn randomly.
Participants will be only given limited amount of prep time.(configuring,managing,etc..)
there won't be any home and away in the final game, in case of tie in final, extra time followed by penalties shall take place.
A match once started won't be restarted again without any coordinators permission.
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 4K
Second Place- Prizes worth 2K Third Place- Prizes worth 1K

events.description: A collaborative online event between writers and artists where you interpret the art/story from that of other contestants. Creativity to its core!
rules:
Takes place over as pan of 1 week (Including registration),
  • Monday-Wednesday:registration period for both writers and artists
  • Wednesday 23:59 :prompts are sent to writers only, given up till Friday afternoon to submit a work of min 500 words
  • Friday afternoon to Friday 23:59 : Artists should choose pieces to work on.
  • Saturday 00:00 : Artists get their allotted pieces and can create any art piece in relation with the written piece till Sunday 23:59
  • Registration window will be open for 12 hours. Afterwhich writers will be given a set of prompts to pick and choose from.
Writers will be allowed to choose one or many prompts,how many ever required to write their story.
The story should have a minimum of 500 words and should be submitted within 24 hours of the registration deadline. This is to ensure the artists will have a written piece to work on.
Written works should be submitted via Google docs(to avoid artists unable to figure out handwriting thus making it difficult for them to draw)

Artists will then be given a 6 hour window to select the works they feel inspired by, and to ensure that no two artists pick the same work, they will provide a top 5 list and will be given a story in their top 5.
Artists will then be given a 24 hour window to come up with an art piece depicting the written work they have chosen, interpreting the text and scenes as they see fit.
Failure to submit the work on time or provide SAMID at the time of submission will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize: First Place- Prizes worth 2K + Surprise Gift Second Place- Prizes worth 1K + Surprise Gift Third Place - Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: Have a thing for recreating comic scripts? Let the wild- est of your imagination flow and deliver an interesting comic script in your own style.
rules: Duration: 2 hrs
Individual Event.

Time limits must be strictly adhered to.
The decision of the judges will be final.

Rubric,

  • Cohesivity
  • Detailing
  • Neatness
events.prize: First Place- Prizes worth 1.5K Second Place- Prizes worth 0.8K Third Place - Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: Let the film roll out of the canister to capture the actor in you and weave it into an amazing short film.
rules: Number of participants:1. Submissions per participant:1
Photos submitted must be at least 640 pixels on the shorter side, and no more than 2000 pixels on the longer side. Images should be no longer than 2MB. Photos must be in JPEG format.

All submitted photos must contain the original EXIF metadata information. However there must be no border(s), logos, copyright marks, identifying marks or any other visible references and/or marks on the image.

Photos that portray or otherwise include appropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other contents deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately discarded.
Organizing committee has complete right to change schedule of the event,cancellation of the event and take any necessary actions in violation of rules.

The copyrights of the submissions made will be entitled to us and will be used for promotions.
7.  The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.

events.description: A well-written script creates in the mind of the reader the experience of watching a movie. To that end, you must describe images, sounds, actions, and speech in such a way that the scenes unspool as they would on a screen.
rules: Script can be in the English, Tamil, Hindi, Telugu.

If the script is written by a writing team, it must be submitted by one of the writers with the consent of the other (any and all prizes will be sent to the writer who submitted the winning script, it is the responsibility of the writing team to share or divide the prizes.
There is no limit to the number of different scripts you may submit. Duplicate entries of the same project, however, will be automatically disqualified.
Once a script has been submitted, no substitutions will be accepted. No corrected pages or revised drafts allowed.
Scripts must be the original work of the author(s)
events.prize: First Place - Prizes worth 3K Second Place - Prizes worth 2K Third Place - Prizes worth 1K

events.description: AA collaborative online event between writers and artists where you interpret the art/story from that of other contestants. Creativity to its core!
rules:
Takes place over as pan of 1 week (Including registration),
  • Monday-Wednesday:registration period for both writers and artists
  • Wednesday 23:59 :prompts are sent to writers only, given up till Friday afternoon to submit a work of min 500 words
  • Friday afternoon to Friday 23:59 : Artists should choose pieces to work on.
  • Saturday 00:00 : Artists get their allotted pieces and can create any art piece in relation with the written piece till Sunday 23:59
  • Registration window will be open for 12 hours. Afterwhich writers will be given a set of prompts to pick and choose from.
Writers will be allowed to choose one or many prompts,how many ever required to write their story.
The story should have a minimum of 500 words and should be submitted within 24 hours of the registration deadline. This is to ensure the artists will have a written piece to work on.
Written works should be submitted via Google docs(to avoid artists unable to figure out handwriting thus making it difficult for them to draw)

Artists will then be given a 6 hour window to select the works they feel inspired by, and to ensure that no two artists pick the same work, they will provide a top 5 list and will be given a story in their top 5.
Artists will then be given a 24 hour window to come up with an art piece depicting the written work they have chosen, interpreting the text and scenes as they see fit.
Failure to submit the work on time or provide SAMID at the time of submission will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize: First Place - Prizes worth 2K + Surprise Gift  Second Place - Prizes worth 1K + Surprise Gift   Third Place - Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: Many dreams and ideas have existed in our rich history of human civilization. But, could those ideologies still be applicable today? Could you convince us of such a dream? Come and test your eloquence and glib of tongue and present us with ways on how to learn from the past to change the future.
rules: Participant will be given a prompt that is based on past myths and fairy tales projected onto today’s context
He/She shall be given 5 minutes of prep time
He/She will then be given 10 minutes to speak and act out the given topic
He/She will be judged on Creativity,Spontaneity,Structure and Complexity.
events.prize: First Place- Prizes worth 2K + Surprise Gift Second Place- Prizes worth 1K + Surprise Gift Third Place - Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: In a time where ideas are in constant clash and flux of each other, it’s time to play the part of the judge and the jury in determining their usefulness. The goal? To convince the judges and the audience (jury) on who is right.
rules: This event will contain three rounds
The first and last round will contain one on one debate while the second round will be a group discussion
Each round will be a knockout
Participants get 5 mins to prepare after prompt is given
Time Structure for each round will be told during event
Prompts will be based on juxtaposing past political ideologies onto today’s context.
Audience interruptions (upto 2 each)for P.o.Is are allowed.
events.prize: First Place- Prizes worth 2K + Surprise Gift Second Place - Prizes worth 1K + Surprise Gift Third Place - Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: Pitch your ideas, advertise them and help us assimilate your business strategy and win big.
rules: Team event
There will be Rs.250 enclosed in the envelope
Team : 2 - 4

Registration Period - as mentioned in the schedule. - In the QMS front desk.

The customers and the Participants are not supposed to trade using cash and are henceforth required to get tokens from the QMS ( Quality Management System ). All transactions will have to made through tokens
No service will be entertained. Only products can be sold. You cannot auction.
35% of all profits made from the event, by every group, will be donated towards climate change.

Coordinators & volunteers will periodically monitor, to assess progress.
10.  Any non-compliance to the aforementioned rules will lead to a fine of Rs.2500, which will also be donated towards the cause of climate cause
